oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grandmother’s Flower Garden quilt

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quilts; Quilting
Quilts; Quilting; Folk art
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Grandmother's Flower Garden quilt hanging from a clothesline. The border of the quilt is lavender and the patterns are in five columns.

Dating to the 18th Century, the Grandmother's Flower Garden pattern is one of the most popular patters. It features hexagonal patches stiched together with the English paper piecing method. The English paper piecing method involves a hexagon template is cut out of paper or light cardboard for each hexagon patch and the patches are stiched together by hand.
